lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: No, he was this creepy guy from high school who had this huge crush on her since like the ninth grade.

lines.speaker: ross with a look of wondering how long this is going to go on on his face
lines.text: Still me.

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: No, I'm not talking about you. <to Rachel> It was your fat   friends brother with that bad afro, do you remember?

lines.speaker: ross starts talking over her 'do you remember' line
lines.text: Amy. I'm going to save you some time, ok. <spins finger around in circle> All me.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Careful. <hands Chandler a china plate> Careful. CAREFUL!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I'll tell you what, for the rest of our lives, I'll be careful until told otherwise. <looks at china> hey wait a minute this isn't the china we picked out..

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I know, after you left the store, I chose different ones.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Why?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: well no offense honey, but your taste is a little feminine for me.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh suddenly, flowers are feminine?   < Phoebe comes in>

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hey, everybody. Happy Thanksgiving!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey happy Thanksgiving.. Pheebs! <motions her to come over>

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hey, what's going on Joe?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I.. I.. I need a good lie.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh okay. How about the whole "man walking on the moon" thing. You know? You. you could. You could see the strings people!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: No, no, no I need a good lie to explain why I wasn't at a work thing today.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Ooh, honey. You stink at lying.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I do not.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh really. Okay. let me ask you something. Yesterday at the coffee house, I went to the bathroom and when I came back, my muffin was gone-who took it?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Somebody opened the door to the coffee house and a raccoon came running in, went straight for your muffin and I said "Hey don't eat that-that's Phoebe's" and he said.. <pause> He said.. "Joey you stink at lying." What am I going to do?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Don't worry, don't worry. We'll come up with a good lie. I'll help you practice it.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh great, that'd be great. Thank you.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Sure, what.. what was the work thing?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Uh.. <forgetting what the work thing was, rolls up his sleeve on his right arm and shows Phoebe, she looks>

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: "Pick up grandma at the airport"?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh.. man..

lines.speaker: amy with straight hair
lines.text: Oh she's precious. Do you ever worry she's going to get your real nose?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Amy! <pause> Yes I do.. I really do. <grabs Ross' hand for support>

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: Hello? Yeah, um. Hang on one sec. <to Ross and Rachel> Can I take this upstairs?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Sure, we don't live there but...

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: Seriously? Its.. its just these rooms? <moves hands around motioning 'just these rooms'> <To Ross> I thought you were a doctor.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah, no. Ross has a PhD.

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: Ew. <walks into Rachel's room, I'm guessing>

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: God she is unbelievable.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I know, I mean a PhD is just as good as an MD.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh sure Ross, yeah. If I have a heart attack in a restaurant, I want you there with your fossil brush.

lines.speaker: amy storms out
lines.text: Stupid Thanksgiving.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What? What happened?

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: My boyfriend canceled on me. I mean.. I I finally find a real relationship. I mean, someone that I can spend this day with and then his wife comes back into town. I swear, its almost not worth dating married guys.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Don't say that.

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: Oh. I was so looking forward to this. It was going to be such a beautiful Thanksgiving. We were going to have sushi.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh Amy, don't cry Amy.  Um.. Ross, could I talk to you in private?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Sure, you want to go upstairs?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Um look I was thinking.. If its ok with Monica I would like to invite Amy to Thanksgiving.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: You know, I think thats a great idea. It'll be like the pilgrims bringing the Indians syphilis.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Look I know she's a little tough to take. She has no where else to go, and she's my sister. Alright, she's Emma's aunt. And I would like them to bond.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Ok, fine, but I don't want them bonding to much. I don't want her telling Emma she needs a nose job.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ross, you know what? She may need one..We're just going to have to make our peace with that!

lines.speaker: rachel opens their door
lines.text: Hi.

lines.speaker: everyone there says
lines.text: Hi, hey.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hey you guys, this is my sister Amy.  This is Chandler, Joey, Phoebe and you know Mon.

lines.speaker: everyone
lines.text: Hi.

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: Oh my god. You're on Days of Our Lives.

lines.speaker: joey laughs
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: wow. They must put a lot of makeup on you.

lines.speaker: joey looks rejected
lines.text: Hap.. Hap.. Happy Thanksgiving.

lines.speaker: ross to monica
lines.text: Hi.

lines.speaker: monica to ross
lines.text: Hi.

lines.speaker: monica to emma
lines.text: Hey you.

lines.speaker: monica to amy
lines.text: So. Welcome. Is this your first time you're seeing Emma?

lines.speaker: amy with confused look on face
lines.text: Yeah I.. I think so. <sticks her hand out to shake hands with Phoebe and says to her> It's nice to meet you Emma.

lines.speaker: phoebe shakes her hand and says
lines.text: Phoe-Be.

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: Oh. That's a funny noise.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Pheebs, I still need some help here

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh right, ok um. Ok so its not just the lie you tell. but its the way you tell it. . For example if you look down at the ground when you're talking, people know you're lying.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh.. I don't know why this is so hard for me. you know.. I mean lying is basically just acting and I am a terrfic actor.

lines.speaker: phoebe looks down
lines.text: You are a terrific actor.

lines.speaker: amy coming out of the bathroom
lines.text: Hey. Hey where's the baby?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh we just put her down for a nap.

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: Oh I was just thinking. You know what would be incredible? If you guys died.

lines.speaker: ross first has a look of 'huh' then changes it to sarcastic happy
lines.text: Thank you Amy.

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: no, no, then I would get the baby. I mean you know it would be just like a movie. Like at first I wouldn't know what to do with her, then I would rise to the occasion and and then I would get a makeover and then I'd get married.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Thats a great movie. <she claps>

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: Now listen, not that you guys could stop me or anything cause you know you'd be dead. I was thinking about changing her name. I'm just not really a big fan of Emily.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Emma.

lines.speaker: amy turns around to phoebe
lines.text: Emma, Ross wants you.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: PHOE-BE.

lines.speaker: amy turns to ross and rachel
lines.text: Why does she keep making that noise?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Honey, I don't know how to tell you this, but um, if something were to happen to Ross or to myself <Ross and Rachel knock on wood> um you wouldn't get the baby.

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: Well who would?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Well we haven't offically asked them yet, but we would want Monica and Chandler.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I can't believe you'd want us to raise Emma.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: yeah oh my god, I'm so moved.

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: I don't believe this, hold on a second. You guys die and I don't get your baby?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: See look Amy, we're a lot closer to Monica and Chandler. We see them every day. And truthfully honey, you don't seem very connected to the baby.

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: Connected? I mean.. to what? She's.. she's  a lump.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You know, guys I got to say. This means so much to me. That you would trust me with your child. I mean, we all know that Monica and I have been trying to have a baby of our own. You know I've had my doubts about my skills as a father, but that you two.. that you two.... <starts to cry>

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: <points to Chandler> This guy? Seriously?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay! It's time for dinner. Everyone we're using our fancy china.. um and its very expensive so please be careful.

lines.speaker: ross starts playing with a plate
lines.text: Woah. Woah... <nearly really drops the plate and more seriously> Woah.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay, just to be clear comedy with the plates will not be well recieved. <pinches Ross' arm>

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey! How come my plate's less fancy then everyone else's? Do you not trust me with a fancy plate?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: No, honey, its. thats a special plate.  See its a game, whoever gets that plate wins.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I can't believe I won.

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: Its such a slap in the face. I'm your sister and you would give your baby to these strangers over me.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Monica is Ross' sister.

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: No, Ross' sister was really fat.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: That was me.

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: No, she was this really dorky girl in high school that used to follow Rachel around like a puppy dog.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hey. Amy. You've got to stop doing that.

lines.speaker: monica about to have a heart attack
lines.text: Okay, listen I know you're having a little bit of a family crisis, but you don't have to take it out on the plates. I mean, I mean in fact I think that everyone should cut their food like this.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Now see, this way you protect the plate.. and lets face it you have fun.

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: Okay, how about this, you guys die and the crazy plate lady dies, then do I get the baby?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: No, if crazy plate lad.. <sees Monica frustrated at this comment> If Monica dies then I would get Emma, Right?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well actually...

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Actually what?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: well.. its just. its just in that case, then um. Emma would go to my parents.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: Hurts, doesn't it?

lines.speaker: joey raises his hand
lines.text: Uh.. who has to die for me to get her?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: So if Monica's not around, then I'm not good enough to raise Emma?

lines.speaker: ross looks down
lines.text: No,  that that is not what we're saying.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah he's lying. He looked down.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well what is wrong with me? Am I .. am I incomptent? Because I managed to survive whatever it is that killed the three of you!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Honey, you're taking this the wrong way. We think you're going to be a wonderful parent. It's just.. you're more the fun parent.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah and we'd want to make sure Emma has someone like Monica who is more uh. uh discliplinarin.. someone who can be firm and strict.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Thats not how you see me, is it?

lines.speaker: phoebe while cutting a sweet potatoe in the air
lines.text: No you're all about the fun.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Look, I may not know a lot about babies, but do you really think I'm not capable?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No, you both are equally capable. Its just.. you're strongest when.. when you're together.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Ok. So if we both had Emma and I die <knocks on table>  she'd have to give her up.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Sure, Monica would have to give her up.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I lie better then that, right?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: So.. let me get this straight. So my two friends die, I get Emma. Then my wife dies, then Emma the one tiny ray of hope left in my life gets taken away from me?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: There's your movie! <claps>

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey. There you are. You disappeared after dinner.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh? Did somebody miss me? Is there a child to raise poorly?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Ross and Rachel don't know what they're talking about. I mean its not like their so responsible. Emma is a product of a bottle of Merlot and a five year old condom.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah but they're right. I mean, I'm not a strong father figure and I never will be.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: No you learn these things. You grow into it.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah, but its not who I am. Everything they said was exaclty why I was worried about having a kid. And its true. And look everybody knows it.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I don't know it! I want to have a kid with you because I think you're going to be an amazing dad... at the fun parts and the hard parts.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh yeah, well can you picture me saying "Go to your room! You're grounded"?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Can you hear me say "You're grounded"?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You said that to me last week.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: How hard is it? No shoes on the furniture.

lines.speaker: joey groans and gets off the phone
lines.text: The producer from Days left a message on my machine asking why I wasn't at the parade. They said everybody's pissed off at me.. <whiny voice> And they all got to meet Santa!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: It's ok. I thought of the perfect lie for you. It's easy to remember and doesn't invite a lot of questions. You weren't at the parade because you had a family emergency.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh, I like that, yeah. Wasn't at the parade because I had a family emergency.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Ooh, what happened?

lines.speaker: joey all nervous and looking down and fiddling with his ear
lines.text: Oh.. My sister's raccoon.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: No! Nothing with a raccoon.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Arg... Alright, I'll take care of it. <throws hands out in the air>

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh wait.. What are you doing?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Setting the table.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah we thought it would be nice to use the fancy china for dessert too.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh how nice. Maybe later we can all go blow our noses on my wedding dress.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey dude, you okay? Sorry about before.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh no thats okay, you're totally right. I don't know anything about disciplining a child. But it did hurt my feelings and I want you to know that when I die, you don't get Joey.

lines.speaker: amy walks over to the couch and sits down next to rachel
lines.text: Ucch.  <pauses> Uchh <louder this time> In case you hadn't noticed, I'm not talking to you.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: UCHH! <much louder and longer then Amy's>

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: You know.. this.. this is classic Rachel.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah.. yeah right.. Remember in high school when I died and didn't give you my baby?

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: This might be my one chance to have a baby Rachel. I mean, you know that I have been so busy focusing on my carrer.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What? What carrer?

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: Um.. I'm a decorator.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ok. You decorate dad's office and so now you're a decorator. Okay! I went to the zoo yesterday and now I'm a koala bear.

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: Why can't you ever be supportive?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Sup.. You want to talk supportive? You didn't even come and visit me when I was in the hospital having the baby.

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: Oh. Yeah. Well.. You didn't come see me when I was in the hospital when I was getting my lips done.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I did the first time! Oh. Oh.. <gets up and walks into the kitchen> And you know what. You want to know why I'm not giving Emily to you.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Emma.

lines.speaker: rachel turns to ross
lines.text: Oh whose side are you on? <back to Amy> I'm not giving you Emma because there is no way you could handle the responibility of a child.

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: How hard could it be? You do it.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: ooh oooh..

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: Do you want to know why you don't want  me to have the baby?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: uh huh.

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: Because you don't want me to be happy. You.. you have always been jealous of me.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Jealous of what? Of your lack of responsiblity? You, your immaturity? Your total disregard of other people's feelings?

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: Uh.. To name a few.  You know.. You know.. You've just always been like this. You just have to have everything. And I couldn't have anything. Like in junior high, when you stole Timmy from me. I mean, do you even realize how much that hurt me?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Timmy was my boyfriend and you made out with him!

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: Oh come on, that was 20 years ago. Get over it.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I cannot, I cannot believe that I invited you here today.

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: Yeah, well you know what I cannot believe. That my so-called sister, gets a 30% discount from Ralph Lauren and I still have to pay retail.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: ah ha ha. ah ha ha. <evil meancing laughter> It's forty five.

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: You bitch. You just think you're so perfect. With your new baby and your, your small apartment. <directs this to Ross who in turns throws the towel in his hand down on the table> Well let me tell you something. Your baby isn't even that cute.

lines.speaker: ross walks over
lines.text: Too far, Amy. Too far.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: You take that back.

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Take it back!

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: No! What are you going to do? Make me?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Heey man, I work out.

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: So do I.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I do pilates.

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: I do yoga.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Bring it on!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Put the plates in the boxes!! Put the plates in the boxes!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Did you just push me?

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: Uh, yeah I think I did.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Alright. Thats it! <Pushes Amy back>

lines.speaker: monica screaming at ross
lines.text: Forget the bubblewrap! There isn't time!

lines.speaker: rachel starts messing up amy's hair
lines.text: Frizzy frizzy frizzy frizzy!!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh my god! Shouldn't we stop this?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: What? Are you out of your mind? Lets throw some jello on them.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ew! Gross.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Alright! That is it. This is our apartment and you can not behave this way. Now if you can't act your age then you shouldn't be here at all. Now those plates may not be as nice as the pretty pink ones I picked out, but they're very important to Monica. I want you to apologize to her right now.

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: I'm sorry.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Mon, I'm so sorry.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay. Thats better. Now I want you to both apologize to each other and mean it.

lines.speaker: amy and rachel at same time
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: By the way, that fight was totally arousing.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Dude. Well done. You know what? If I die, and Rachel dies and Monica dies then you can totally take care of Emma.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh yeah? Well thanks.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: So, so now do I get Joey?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay, but you should know he eats five times a day and shoves pennies up his nose.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Are you okay Mon?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: uh huh.. I mean these things happen. Its' just a plate. Its not like somebody died.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: It's all right. You can mourn.

lines.speaker: monica starts crying
lines.text: Thank you. It was so beautiful. <gets up and walks towards the front door> I'm going to go to Joeys and get the pies.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Actually its not pies, its just pie.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I don't care. <pauses and realizes...> Oh my god. I've lost the will to scold.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Look Amy, it got a little of control..Um.. and I'm sorry. You're my sister and uh.. if it really means that much to you..

lines.speaker: amy
lines.text: So you're going to give me the baby?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Uh. No.. I was going to let you use my Ralph Lauren discount.

lines.speaker: amy starting to cry
lines.text: You are not going to regret this.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: She needs changing.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh no no no.. I'll get her. I'm super-compentent and totally responsibile and fourth in line to raise Emma. I'll be right there Emma. Just let me get my trusty diaper bag here. <knocks over the box of china> Well.. what do you know? I guess, I'll be the one who dies first.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hey, does Monica know about her broken plates yet?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Nope...

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Broke them all, huh?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yep...

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: You gonna tell her?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Nope...  Hey... so I'm gonna... put the plates back. You know, I think you were right, I don't think we should use these plates again for a looong time.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Like only if the queen comes?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Maybe not even then.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey! I did it. I called my producer. I told him I had a family emergency, he totally bought it. Thanks for teaching me how to lie Pheebs.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: No problem! Next week: stealing...

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Bye plates!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh, you told her you broke all the plates, huh?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What? Something happened with the plates?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Uhm...  Yeah... this uhm... raccoon came in...

lines.speaker: jo lynn
lines.text: This kitty is Mittens and this one is Fitzhugh, and this little guy in the cat condo is Jinkies.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yep.� That's a lot of cats Jo Lynn.� Single are ya?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Chandler Bing.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey.� How come you're answering your own phone?� Where's your crazy assistant?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What's up Joe?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Okay, what have we always wanted to do together?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Braid each other's hair and ride horseback on the beach?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: No, no, no.� When you get home tomorrow night, you and I are going to be at the Wizzards-Knicks game . . .� courtside!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Courtside?� Oh my God.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah.� Maybe Michael Jordon will dive for the ball and break my jaw with his knee.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: That's so cool.� I'll let Monica know.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hello?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Joey just called.� He's got courtside Knicks tickets for him and me tomorrow night.

lines.speaker: monica

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: It's so unfair, you don't even like your job!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: So, who does?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, I like my job.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I *love* my job.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah, I can't *wait* to go back to work.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I can't get *enough* dinosaurs!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I'm sorry, I won't be here.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: It's just... It's hard enough not seeing you during the week, but for Christmas... alright, if this is what you have to do, I understand.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Thanks.  I'll see you New Year's Day.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You're not gonna be here New Year's Eve??

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Did I not mention that?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: No!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: AND TO ALL A GOOD NIGHT!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: All right everybody, I know that it's Christmas Eve and you'd rather be with your families, but there's *no* call  for writing "Screw you, Mr. Bing!" on the back of my chair!  -- By the way, you can all call me Chandler.

lines.speaker: wendy
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: others
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey. Where've you been?

lines.speaker: wendy
lines.text: I was, uh, checking out that insurance company's Christmas party on three, oh, it was really beautiful, they have all these decorations and this huge tree and I just, uh... to hell with them, we have to work. -- So I stole ther ham.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You hear that? You may not be with your families, but at least it's gonna smell like ham in here.

lines.speaker: claudia
lines.text: My kid's in a play right now.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Y'know what, I know what will cheer you guys up!  I had a little talk with the boys in New York, told 'em about all the hard work you've been doing and that a little Christmas bonus may be in order.

lines.speaker: ken
lines.text: "A donation has been made in your name to the New York City Ballet".

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, that's like money in your pocket! - Alright look, you want me to say it? This sucks. Being here sucks! This work sucks!

lines.speaker: wendy
lines.text: *Now* it feels like Christmas.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I'm sorry. Hey, at least you guys get to go home and be with your families tonight. I have to go back to an empty hotel room and lay down on a very questionable bedspread. And then tomorrow morning, you get to have Christmas morning in your own houses, wich, by the way, none of you have invited me to.

lines.speaker: ken
lines.text: You can come to my house!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Haha, no thanks!

lines.speaker: wendy
lines.text: That was a nice pep-talk.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh, thanks! I'm... actually thinking about becoming a motivational speaker.

lines.speaker: wendy
lines.text: So, if you were home right now, what would you be doing?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Typical Christmas-y stuff, you know? Our holidays are pretty traditional...

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: So here is a, a very special holiday song that I wrote for some very important people to me.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay, Pheebs, you look in the kitchen, I will look in the back closet.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I can save you time ladies, I'm right here.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah, Chandler why don't you take a walk? This doesn't concern you.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: We are looking for our Christmas presents from Monica.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What? That's terrible!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: No-no, we do it every year!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh well, that, that makes it not terrible.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: No, yeah, we never find them! She's always best at us, that wily... minx.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Don't worry, we're just gonna search here for an hour, and then we're gonna go over to Joey's and search, OK?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: No not okay, you can't look for Monica's presents!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh no, we have to!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: No, you don't have to, and you can't because I, I live here too.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well then, you should look with us.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Why?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Chandler, aren't you worried about what to get Monica for Christmas?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: No, I have a great idea for a present for her.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, that's it?  A great idea! Oh yeah.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Chandler, that's not enough. I mean what if she gets you a great present, two medium presents, and a bunch of little presents? And you've just gotten her one great present? I mean that's just gonna make her feel bad. Why would you do that to her Chandler? Why? Why?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: If I help, we can find 'em faster!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: That's right!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Ooh ooh, we have a live one!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, it's a Macy's bag!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Ooh, who's it for?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: "Dear losers, do you really think I'd hide presents under the couch? P.S.: Chandler, I knew they'd break you."

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Rach, these are for you.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Wiper blades. I don't even have a car.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: No, but with this new car smell, you'll think you do.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: OK, Pheebs, your turn.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Ahh, toilet seat covers! Is that what you were doing while I was getting gas?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Uh-huh.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: You guuuyys.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: And for Ross, Mr. Sweet-tooth.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: You got me a cola drink?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: And, a lemon lime.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Well this, this is too much, I feel like I should get you another sweater.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: And last but not least.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: They're ribbed for *your* pleasure.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Ooh, hey Ben, what if the Holiday Armadillo told you all about the Festival of Lights?

lines.speaker: ben
lines.text: Cool!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Come on Ben.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Years and years ago there were these people called the Maccabees...

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Ho, ho, ho! Merry Christmas!

lines.speaker: ben
lines.text: Santa!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What are you doing here, Santa?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, I'm here to see my old buddy Ben. What are you doing here, weird...turtle-man?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I'm the Holiday Armadillo, your part-Jewish friend. You sent me here to give Ben some presents. Remember?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay Ben, why don't you come open some more presents, and Santa, the Armadillo and I have a little talk in the kitchen? There's a sentence I'd never thought I'd say.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What are you doing?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You called everyone and said you were having trouble finding a Santa costume, so I borrowed one from a guy at work!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Thank you, but, but you, you gotta leave.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Why?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Because, I'm finally getting him excited about Hanukkah, and, and you're-you're wrecking it.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: But I didn't get to shake my belly like a bowl full of jelly.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I'm sorry Chandler, but this, this is really important to me.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Fine, I'll give the suit back.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey, you think, you can keep it another night?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Santa? Really?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yeah, is that okay?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Did your Dad ever dress up like Santa?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Then it's okaaay!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You know what, everybody? Go home. You should be with your families. It's bad enough that we're working New Year's Eve.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Did I not tell *anyone* about New Year's Eve? -- Alright, look, go! Go home, okay? Merry Christmas! Go.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Good, God's speed, good people!  You're not gonna go?

lines.speaker: wendy
lines.text: Naah... I couldn't leave you alone.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Ah. Thanks.

lines.speaker: wendy
lines.text: Besides, I can't leave until their Christmas party downstairs clears out; there are some *pissed off* insurance people looking for that ham.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Ah.  Chandler Bing.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hi Honey! We're all here; we just want to wish you a Merry Christmas.

lines.speaker: others
lines.text: Merry Christmas!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Ble-blah-blar Blargh!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Ahh, Merry Christmas; I miss you guys!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: So is it horrible? Is everybody working really hard?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Ah, well no, it's just uh, me and Wendy.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Wendy? -- That sounds like a girl's name.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: It is. Did I... not tell you about her?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Umhmm, umhmm, about the time you told me about New Year's Eve. Where is everybody else?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I sent them home.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Ohh, you are such a good boss! Is she pretty?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Uhh, uh...

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Answer faster, answer faster!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I don't know!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Answer better, answer better!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I don't think of her that way, you know, she's a, she's a colleague.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What does she do there?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh, she's regional Vice President; She's... just below me.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: She did WHAT?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: BE-LOW me!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Ahh, wait, is Wendy the runner-up Miss Oklahoma?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: *What*??

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, she... she didn't win...

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Alright, well, maybe I should let you and the second prettiest girl in Oklahoma get back to work.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, second prettiest that year; I mean, of *all* the girls in Oklahoma, she's probably...

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh Chandler, stop talking!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Honey, there's really nothing to worry about.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I'm serious!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Merry Christmas.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Merry Christmas.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Merry Christmas, you guys!

lines.speaker: others
lines.text: Yeah, Merry... Christmas.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Blah blargah, blar-blab.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: The wife says "Hi!".

lines.speaker: wendy
lines.text: Ah. Fun conversation?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Ah well, she's got this weird idea, that, uh, y'know, just because you and I are alone, that something is gonna happen.

lines.speaker: wendy
lines.text: Huh? Really? -- Hm, that'd be so terrible?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: This is probably the wrong thing to be worrying about, but... you're getting ham on my only tie.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Whoa-ho, back off, Missy!

lines.speaker: wendy
lines.text: ...Missy?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I don't know; I'm not used to girls making passes at me! ...  Wait a minute... am I sexy in Oklahoma?

lines.speaker: wendy
lines.text: You are to me...

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: No,... no...  NO!  Look, I'm, I'm married!

lines.speaker: wendy
lines.text: So? I'm married.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I'm *happily* married.

lines.speaker: wendy
lines.text: Oh. - What's *that* like?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Right. So, I'm sorry...

lines.speaker: wendy
lines.text: Seriously? Happily married. So that phone call before, that was ... happy?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well look, it's not easy to spend this much time apart, you know. She's entitled to be a little paranoid... or, in this case: right on money! ... You know, she's amazing, and beautiful, and smart, and if she were here right now, ...she'd kick your ass. Look, you're a really nice person... ham stealing and adultery aside. But, what I have with my wife is pretty great, so nothing is ever gonna happen between us.

lines.speaker: wendy
lines.text: Okay, let me ask you something: if what you and your wife have is so great, then why are you spending Christmas with me?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I mean, you were the most beautiful woman in the room tonight!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You kidding? You're the most beautiful woman in most rooms...   Whoa! Whoa! Whoa! What's going on? You and I just made out! You and I are making out?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Well, not anymore.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: But we don't do that.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I know, I just thought it would be fun.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: How drunk are you?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Drunk enough that I know I wanna do this. Not so drunk that you should feel guilty about taking advantage.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: That's the perfect amount!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Y'know what's weird?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: This doesn't feel weird!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I know.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You're a really good kisser.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, I have kissed over four women.  Do you wanna get under the covers?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hm-hmm!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Wow! You are really fast!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: It bodes well for me that speed impresses you.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: We're gonna see each other naked.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yep!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Do you wanna do it at the same time?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Count of three?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: One!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Two!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Two!

lines.speaker: both
lines.text: Three!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well I think it's safe to say that our friendship is effectively ruined.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Eh, we weren't that close anyway!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Eh!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: So, are you really gonna go out with that nurse man?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Well uh, you and I are just goofing around, I thought, why not just goof around with him.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Y'know, I don't know if you've ever looked up the term goofing around in the dictionary... Well, I have, and the technical definition is, two friends who care a lot about each other and have amazing sex and just wanna spend more time together. But if you have this new fangled dictionary that gets you made at me, then we have to, y'know, get you my original dictionary. I am *so* bad at this.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I think you're better than you think you are.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Really? Okay, so...

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Know when to stop.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Y'know, I sensed that I should stop. So we're okay?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yeah.  Don't do the dance.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Right!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I can't get married until I get something old, something new, something borrowed, and something blue.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay, all right, all right, all right! Okay!  Okay, here's something, here's something blue and new.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You're so efficient. I love you!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Let's go!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: No-no-no, wait! We need something old!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh, okay, I have condom in my wallet that I've had since I was twelve.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: That'll work!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I don't think so.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay, now we just need something borrowed!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Here just...take this.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: That's stealing!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: No, we'll-we'll bring it back! Just put it under your dress.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Ohh.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay, one thing at a time.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Listen umm, I've been thinking, it's not fair for me to ask you to spend all of your money on our wedding. I mean, you work, you work really hard for that.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Ehh.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Eh, you work for that.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Look, I thought about it too, and I'm sorry. I think we should spend all of the money on the wedding.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You do?!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah, I'm putting my foot down. Yeah look, when I proposed I told you that I would do anything to make you happy, and if having the perfect wedding makes you happy, then, then that's what we're gonna do.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh, you're so sweet.  Oh, but wait, what about our, what about the future and stuff?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Eh, forget about the future and stuff! So we only have two kids, y'know? We'll pick our favorite and that one will get to go to college.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You thought about that?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: How many kids were we gonna have?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Uh, four, a boy, twin girls and another boy.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What else did you think about?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, stuff like where we'd live, y'know? Like a small place outside the city, where our kids could learn to ride their bikes and stuff. Y'know, we could have a cat that had a bell on its collar and we could hear it every time it ran through the little kitty door. Of course, we'd have an apartment over the garage where Joey could grow old.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Y'know what? I-I don't want a big, fancy wedding.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Sure you do.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: No, I want everything that you just said. I want a marriage.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You sure?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Uh-hmm.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I love you so much.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I love you.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oohh, I love it!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Really? You're not gonna return it?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well, not this second!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hey look, you guys, it's snowing!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh wow, it's so beautiful...

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Wow, it really is!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: "Wendy" is a fat girl name.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Aren't we done with that?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay, fine. Let's talk about snow. -- Do you think it's snowing in Tulsa, where my husband is having sex on a copying machine?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh my god...

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey-heeyyy - Look at that, it's a Christmas miracle!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What are you doing here?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I wanted to be with you. I missed you so much.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey, hey, uh, who did you miss the most?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Monica.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Got ya.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I never want to leave you again!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: But I thought if you left, you get fired.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Turns out they can't fire me. Because I quit.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What, you, you really quit your job?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah! It's a stupid job, and I could not stand leaving you. And why should I be the only one who doesn't get to do what he *really* wants to do?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What do you really want to do?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I have *not* thought this through!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh my god!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I know, I, I should have talked to you first about it.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: No, I think that this is what you wanna do, I think it's great!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Thanks!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Chandler, your being here is the best Christmas present I could have ever imagined.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Ahh...

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Now give me my real gift.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Here, pass these, will ya..

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh, hey...

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: "A donation has been made in your name to the New York City Ballet." -- How did you know?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Wha... are you kidding? I can't return this.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I... thought it was a timely start to thinking about other people. Besides, this gift still says I love you guys.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Mine's is to Lilian Myers.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I don't have a *job*!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Actuary... no. Book-keeper... no. Topless dancer...   Hey, d'you know what I just realized? You are the sole wage earner. *You* are the head of the household. I don't do anything - I'm a kept man!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You are!  Hey, here's twenty bucks. -- Why don't you go buy yourself something pretty while I'm at work tomorrow?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Did you see our bank statement? Can this be right?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I know...God. I haven't seen my savings take a hit like this since I was a kid and they came up with double-stuffed Oreos. What happened to all our money?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I'm not sure what they did, but I'm inclined to blame Enron.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I guess with you doing the internship, we're just spending more than we're bringing in.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Maybe I should quit and get a job that pays.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh, But you're finally doing something that you love! I can't ask you to give that up. Though it'd be nice if the thing that you love was y'know... finding gold.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You know what? You know what? I think we're making too big a deal out of this. ok? So we pay our bills a little late this month and maybe next month we cut back on a few things. And maybe we start eating out of Joey's refrigerator for a change. You're chef... what can you make out of backing soda and beer?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Ok worse case scenario is...we borrow some money from my parents.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: No! We're not borrowing money.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Why not?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Because we don't do that. We are Bings! And if there's one thing my father taught me was... well to always knock before going into the pool house... but the other thing was never borrow money.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Wow! I Had no idea you had this much pride.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: That's right! I do! And I'm your man. And I'm going to get us through this situation even if it means you working twice as hard.

lines.speaker: mike
lines.text: I'm gonna go.

lines.text: Why??

lines.speaker: mike
lines.text: I haven't been home in a couple of days and I need to get some more clothes.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh...you don't have to go, I have something that will fit you.

lines.speaker: mike
lines.text: I put that tube top on as a joke.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I want you to stay.

lines.speaker: mike
lines.text: I want to stay too but I've gone as bad as much use out of these boxers as I can..

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Why don't you turn them inside ou...

lines.speaker: mike
lines.text: Done it.  I'll be back in a couple of hours.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I'll miss you.

lines.speaker: mike
lines.text: Me too.  You know what? I just realised something. I don't wanna go home.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Great! Ok...I'll go get the tube top.

lines.speaker: mike
lines.text: No, no! What I mean is, I hate going back to my apartment now... and partly because I live above a known crack den but... mostly because when I'm there, It's just, I really miss you. So.. do you want to move in together?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Wow, Mike Hannigan...You sure know how to make a girl say "Hell yeah!"

lines.speaker: mike
lines.text: So we're doing it?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah! Let's do it! Let's live together!  Oh god, we're really going to move in together!

lines.speaker: mike
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I've always wanted to live with a guy. "Pick up your socks!" "Put down the toilet seat!" "No! We're not having sex anymore!" It's gonna be fun!

lines.text: Hey!

lines.text: Ok first of all...It would be great. But that's not what I'm here to talk to you about. I need to borrow some money.

lines.text: Oh er... well you know Emma started crawling? I realised that this place, is very unsafe for a baby. So I went to the store and got some stuff to baby-proof the apartment.
