lines.text: Unbelievable, my classmates are gonna think I'm dead, my professors, my... my parents are gonna get phone calls. You're messing with people's feelings here.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You wanna talk about people's feelings? You should have heard how hurt professor Stern was yesterday when I told him I wouldn't be able to go with him to Key West!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: You've really crossed the line here, but that's okay, it's ok 'cause I'm on my way to buy some Photoshop software and a stack of gay porn. That's right! Your coming out is about to get real graphic.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: God, I wish Mike were here.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay if Mike were here what would the two of you be doing?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What are you, animals? It's 4 o'clock in the afternoon!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I gotta call him. Just to talk to him, there's no harm in that.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Phoebe, that's how it starts. I don't need to eat the cake, I'll just smell the icing... why don't I just eat a little sliver, or, okay, just a slice or two. And next thing you know, you're 210 pounds and you get wedged in going down the tunnel slide. Phoebe, honey, I know this is hard. Look, if you talk to him, you're going to wanna see him. And if you see him, you're going to want to get back together with him. I know that's not what you want.  Give me your phone.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Here.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: And now your cell.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: This is your cellphone?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: This is your current cellphone?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yes, it reminds me of a simpler time.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Phoebe, where's your purse?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: No, no! Give it to me!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: You can't have it.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Give it to me!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: No

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I'll go in there.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh yeah.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Phoebe come here

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Haha!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Damn you Monica Geller hyphen Bing!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey, look who's here! It's Joey, and he brought home a friend.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Joey, Emma's right here! You promised not to bring girls home in the middle of the day anymore.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: No, no, it's not a girl, it's... a brand new Hugsy!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh that's so great, now Emma has two Hugsy's.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: No, no, Emma has one Hugsy, the new Hugsy, huh? The other Hugsy, I don't know, I guess I'll just take it back.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh you know what? When I was a little girl I had a little pink pony named Cotton. Oh I loved her so much, I took her everywhere, I would braid her tail...

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Make the transfer!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Should I be concerned that a button fell off the old Hugsy and I can't find it?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh, no don't worry about that, I swallowed that years ago.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, I don't think she likes the new Hugsy.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: But he's the same.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah, I think she wants the old one back.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: But he's the same.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Joey, come on!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: He's the same!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: You're not the same!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Haha!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: You know, it's a lot less surprising to do that after I've buzzed you into the building.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: So Phoebe, why are there men's shoes by the door.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Those are my shoes.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh, when you get over this breakup we need to go shopping.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Monica, I really appreciate you checking in on me, but I'm actually feeling a lot better. Yeah, I just kinda want to be alone right now.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Who's that?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I ordered Chinese food.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: What are the chances? 1 billion Chinese people and they send Mike!?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What are you doing here?

lines.speaker: mike
lines.text: Phoebe called me.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Phoebe!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I'm sorry, I broke down... I wanted to see him.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Damnit Phoebe! How did you even call him?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: There is a speakerphone on the base unit...

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Base Unit! Think Monica! Think!

lines.speaker: mike
lines.text: Look, if I wanna see Phoebe and she wants to see...

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: This doesn't concern you!!

lines.speaker: mike
lines.text: Oh! Sorry, I guess I was thrown off by the mention of my name!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Look, guys, you can't do this, it's just going to make getting over each other, that much harder.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Not if nothing happens. Why can't... why can't we just hang out as friends?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Sure! If you're just gonna hang out as friends, then maybe I'll join ya. You know, I'm your friend  and Mike's friend .

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Sit down.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh wow wow wow!! Make room for your friend!

lines.speaker: mike
lines.text: So how've you been?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I've been pretty good!

lines.speaker: mike
lines.text: You look really beautiful.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Thanks, you look good too.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh no no no no... this is dangerous territory. Keep it clean!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: So how's the piano playing going?

lines.speaker: mike
lines.text: Actually I've been playing a lot of love songs lately. I've missed you.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I've missed you too.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You know, on the way over here, I saw this drunk guy throw up. And then a pigeon ate it!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey, Ross, I just wanted to apologize... ..don't tell me you actually made those gay pictures of me?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: uhu uhu, check this out.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Huh! So that's what I would look like if I worked out... and was being serviced by a policeman. You're not actually going to send these out are ya?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Eh..actually no, I don't need to because your little "Ross is dead" joke didn't work, ok, there were no responses. Nobody posted anything on the website, nobody called my parents, so the joke my friend is on you. Nobody called, nobody wrote anything, nobody cares that I'm dead.  Oh my God! Nobody cares that I'm dead!?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: No, come on, you know that's not true.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What are you talking about? You get sixty responses just for coming out of the closet! I didn't get one response! And I'm dead!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, the gay community is a lot more vocal than the dead community.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I can't believe this. Not even my geology lab partner? And I carried that guy!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Alright look, let's think about this, ok, do you really think that people are gonna stir up your family at this tragic time? That people are gonna post condolences on a website? This is not about people not caring that you're dead .This is about people not having a decent outlet for their grief.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: You're right. There isn't a decent outlet.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Right, I mean, come on, I'm sure that if you had a funeral or a memorial service, tons of people would come.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Exactly!!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Ross, what're you... what're you... what are you doing? You're having a memorial service for yourself!?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No! That would be stupid! You're having it for me!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Ross, don't press send, don't press se... !

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: oh, too late, too late! It's sent... oops sorry and so is the picture of you and the police man...

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I'm trying to put Emma down for a nap, have you seen Hugsy?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Original or crappy?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Original.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: No, sorry haven't seen him.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Then what's that big lump under your covers?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: It's Monica, ok?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: That's not Monica!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Alright!! Fine! It's original Hugsy! No, now I know that Emma wants him but he's mine and I need him..

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh God.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: ... she's being unreasonable!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Joey, there is a reason that Emma loves that stupid penguin so much  Oh don't cover its ears!  It's because it reminds her of her uncle Joey!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: It does?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah! And she's comforted by him because she loves her uncle Joey so much.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Really? She... she loves me?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh yeah! But you know what? If you need Hugsy, don't worry. Emma will totally understand. I won't... but whatever .

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Ok, wait wait wait wait a minute wait a minute, I mean Rach, I mean if if... . If Hugsy means that much to Emma then... well she can have him.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oooh... you're sweet, I knew uncle Joey would step up.  Look Emma, look who's baaack!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Look forget it forget it... I can't do it.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Are you gonna... you're going to take Hugsy away from a little child?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: How do you think I got him in the first place?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Alright you two, I'm gonna go to the bathroom. Now I don't want anything going on while I'm gone. Here's a few things you can discuss: mucus, fungus and the idea of me and Ross doing it.

lines.speaker: mike
lines.text: I've missed you so much! No, I'm not gonna ask you to get back together because I know we want different things, but just to be with you one more night.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I know, I want that too, but IS that going to make it too hard?

lines.speaker: mike
lines.text: It can't be any harder than this... I mean, If I had known the last time I saw you would be the last time, I... I would have stopped to memorize your face, the way you move, everything about you. If I had known the last time I kissed you would have been the last time... I never would have stopped.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Kiss him, you fool!!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Didn't you hear that speech? If you don't kiss him then I will!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, I missed you so much!

lines.speaker: strange man
lines.text: I knew you'd be here!

lines.speaker: mike
lines.text: Oh, crap!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Who is this?

lines.speaker: mike
lines.text: My friend Manny. I asked him to keep me away from you.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hi, that's what I'm doing for Phoebe!

lines.speaker: manny
lines.text: Well, you are not doing a very good job!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Excuse me?

lines.speaker: manny
lines.text: What's with the kissing?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey, at least I knew where my guy was.

lines.speaker: manny
lines.text: Oh yeah yeah, thank God you were here to oversee all the kissing!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You didn't hear the speech!

lines.speaker: manny
lines.text: I've heard the speech:  "if he knew it was gonna be the last time he saw her... "

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey, it was very moving! You're just heartless!

lines.speaker: manny
lines.text: You're weak!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You're... weird!

lines.speaker: manny
lines.text: Your pants are undone!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh !

lines.speaker: manny
lines.text: Where did they go?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Damn it!

lines.speaker: manny
lines.text: Oh we blew it. I blame myself.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: And I blame you too.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: It's been an hour and not one of my classmates has shown up! I tell you, when I actually die some people are gonna get seriously haunted!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: There you go! Someone came!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Ok, ok! I'm gonna go hide! Oh, this is so exciting, my first mourner!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hi, glad you could come.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Please, come in.

lines.speaker: tom
lines.text: Hi, you're Chandler Bing, right? I'm Tom Gordon, I was in your class.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh yes, yes... let me... take your coat.

lines.speaker: tom
lines.text: Thanks... uh... I'm so sorry about Ross, it's...

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: At least he died doing what he loved... watching blimps

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Who is he?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Some guy, Tom Gordon.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I don't remember him, but then again I touched so many lives.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: So, did you know Ross well?

lines.speaker: tom
lines.text: Oh, actually I barely knew him. Yeah, I came because I heard Chandler's news. D'you know if he's seeing anyone?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yes, he is. Me.

lines.speaker: tom
lines.text: What? You... You... Oh! Can I ask you a personal question? Ho-how do you shave your beard so close?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Ok Tommy, that's enough mourning for you! Here we go, bye bye!!

lines.speaker: tom
lines.text: Hey, listen. Call me.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Ok!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I'm dead and no one cares?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I look like a man??

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Please, one ridiculous problem at a time!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: It isn't ridiculous, look around! No one's here!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You gave them one day's notice, not everyone in our class checks the web site everyday and Monica... it's probably the way you stand!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yes, you're right. Still somebody must have seen it... I mean, I went to that school for 4 years, I didn't have an impact on anyone?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh, that's not true. You had an impact on me, I mean, it's 15 years later and we're still best friends. Doesn't that count for something?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah...

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I'm sure it's somebody for you. Now, go hide.

lines.speaker: kori
lines.text: Hi. I'm here for Ross Geller's memorial service.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Kori? Kori Weston?

lines.speaker: kori
lines.text: Yeah...

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Wow! You look amazing!

lines.speaker: kori
lines.text: And you are...

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Chandler, Chandler Bing. I'm not gay, I'm not gay at all.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You are married though.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Don't listen to him, he's in a really bad mood!

lines.speaker: kori
lines.text: I can't believe that Ross is gone. It is just so sad.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I didn't know Ross and you were so close.

lines.speaker: kori
lines.text: We weren't but we had one class together. He was such a great guy and he talked so passionately about science. I always remembered him.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I'm sure that would mean a lot to him. And if heaven has a door, I'm sure he's pressing his ear up against it and listening intently.

lines.speaker: kori
lines.text: I thought so many times about calling him and asking him out. I guess I really missed my chance.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: But you didn't! I'm still alive!! Kori, I know this is a big surprise for you. It's a long story but the things you just said really made my day! I mean, the fact that you are here means more to me than if this room were filled with people!

lines.speaker: kori
lines.text: You sick freak, who does that? I can't believe I had a crush on you!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Did you hear that? Kori Weston had a crush on me!!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No Mum, I'm not dead. I know it's not something to kid about. It was just a practical joke between Chandler and me, but it's over, ok?  Actually no, even if I had died, you would not be left childless.  Monica?

lines.speaker: teleplay
lines.text: Sherry Bilsing - Graham & Ellen Plummer   Story: Brian Buckner & Sebastian Jones   Directed by: Gary Halvorson   Transcribed by: Eleonora, Pheeboh, Roni & Vanessa

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Monica, hey, can I borrow the Porsche?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Ok.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Alright!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: But ehm...what is it not?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: A place to entertain my lady friends.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: And what else is it not?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: A place to eat spaghetti.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Very good!  What do you need it for anyway?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh well, the powerball lottery is upto 300 million and they don't sell tickets here in New York, so...

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh! So you're driving up to Connecticut?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah Connecticut...Not West Virginia.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey, maybe I'll drive you up there! I'd like to buy some tickets myself!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Uh!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yeah with Chandler not getting paid, we could really use 300 million dollars.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah, because if I was at my old job we'd say 300 million? No thank you!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hey will you get me tickets too?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah me too. oh! I have an idea. Why don't we all pitch in 50 bucks, we'll pool our money together and then if we win, we'll split it!

lines.speaker: everyone almost simultaneously except ross
lines.text: yeah thats a great idea!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No thanks!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: You don't wanna win the lottery?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Uh...sure I do, and I also wanna be King of my own country and find out what happened to Amelia Earhart.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Still on Amelia Earhart?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: The woman just vanished!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Seriously, Ross, you don't want in on this?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No! Do you know what your odds are of winning the lottery? I...I mean you have a better chance of being struck by lightning 42 times.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yes but there's six of us so we'd only have to get struck by lightning 7 times.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I like those odds!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Seriously you guys, I can't believe you're going to spend 250 dollars on the lottery, I mean that's such a bunch of boohaki.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I'll ask.  Boohaki?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh oh, we think Emma is about to start talking so we're trying to be careful about what words we use in front of her.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah so get ready to hear alot of ehm...boohaki, goshdarnit and brotherpucker.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: How do you know she's gonna start talking?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well when I talk to her I almost feel like she understands what I'm saying.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Kinda like Joey.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: What's that now?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: God! Look at all these tickets! It's so exciting! You know I haven't won anything since the sixth grade.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Pie eating contest?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh! You assume because I was heavy that's the only way I could win something?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: No, I saw a picture of you covered in blueberries.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: That was a good day!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: They're towing your car, they're towing your car!!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I'm parked in a garage on Morton!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: They're towing a car. And I am seeing...spots.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh my god Ross! You don't have Emma! And Rachel you don't have Emma!  Where's Emma? Who has Emma!?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Joey relax! My mother picked her up two hours ago. You were there!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I was?

lines.speaker: racel
lines.text: Yes and you talked to her...

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I did?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: She dropped off a casserole?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh yeah! The casserole lady.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: So, did you come by to watch us win the big bucks?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah, uh... and then I figured after you win, we could all go out to the balcony and see a night rainbow with gremlins dancing on top of it!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Don't touch the phone! I'll get it, I'll get it, I'll get it!!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Think he washed his hands?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hello? Hey Charlie, what do you know?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What's going on?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Chandler is supposed to find out if he's getting an assistent job at his ad agency. But out of the 15 interns, they are only hiring three.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Ooh! Tough odds!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah if only it were a sure thing like your 24 state lottery!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Look who's coming around!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Damnit. Alright call me when you know more.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Did you get it?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: One of the slots got filled.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: By you!?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Sense the tone! No that kid Nate got it.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh! I hate that guy! I mean come on kid! Pull up your pants!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah I know.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well, there's two spots left right?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah...I mean I want this so much! I mean, I wanna get one, I want my friend Charlie to get one...Except I don't care about Charlie.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hey you guys! Ok, you're not going to believe this! I just saw my psychic and she said I was definitely gonna win the lottery tonight!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey that reminds me, I thought we could use some extra luck so I brought a wishbone home from work.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: A psychic AND a wishbone? Guys! Give someone else a chance!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Alright, who wants to do it?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh can I? Vegetarians never get to do the wishbone. It's really not fair either! You know, just because we don't eat the meat doesn't mean we don't like to play with the carcasses!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Ok, hey Rach?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh no, I'm good, I don't wanna get that turkey smell all over my hands.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I'll do it!! It'll get the casserole stink off of mine.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I hope I win!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Well, it doesn't really matter ... you're both wishing for the same thing, right?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I can't tell you what I'm wishing for! Else...you know...won't come true!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Right! .. but we "know" what you're wishing for!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Can't really say!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I understand, but you're wishing for what we think you're wishing for, aren't you?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I'm not really comfortable with these questions!

lines.speaker: rachel, chandler and monica
lines.text: Please, just do it!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: One, two, three!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I won, hey!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: You know what, I'm sure your wish is gonna come true, but, you guys - just in case, maybe a genie will come out if we rub this lamp!  Ah!! That thing gets hot!!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: You know, Ross, just keep making your jokes. How are you gonna feel if we actually do win?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Uh, you're not gonna win.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, I know, I know, the odds are against us, but somebody has to win, and it could be us! And then how you gonna feel? You know, we're gonna be all like "oh everybody, let's take our helicopters up to the cape" and you're gonna be all like "oh, I can't guys, I'll meet you guys up there, I gotta gas up the Hyundai"

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Ok, I've heard myself on tape and I sound nothing like that.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I can see the headline now: "Lottery winners' friend filled with regret eats own arm".

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Why would I eat my own arm?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well you wouldn't, but we own the paper, we can print whatever we want.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You know what, Ross? I'm gonna throw in 50 bucks for you.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Why?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Because I know that you think the lottery is "boohaki" but we're all here and gonna watch the numbers and have fun. And you're my brother, and I want you to be a part of this.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: You don't have to do that, I'll pay for myself. But just the fact that you want me to have fun with you guys - that's so sweet! Come here

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Get a room!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Ok, so now that you're in, what are you gonna do if we win?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I don't know, probably just invest it.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Ooh! Calm down ...

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Seriously, that's your fantasy? To invest it?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh, I'm sorry, did I say "invest it"? I meant "be cool and piss it all away"

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Ooh, ooh, I know! We should pool all own money and buy the Knicks!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I don't really care about the Knicks.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh, you will when I pick you as starting forward.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: You would do that? I never get picked!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You know, I'm not sure a sports team is the way to go.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: You're not gonna let me buy the Knicks?? I can't believe you're taking this away from me!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You're right, it has been you dream for over 15 seconds.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Uh, how long until they announce the numbers, Mommy?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I'll take this one too  Uh ... Mommy?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh, I've gotten into the habit of calling Rachel "Mommy" when we're around Emma. Which I now realize we are not ...

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I'm hoping that if she hears it enough it will be her first word.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Although if we're gonna do that, we should probably call me "Daddy" too.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oooh, I like that, "daddy"

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I ... I was just talking about Rachel.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oooh, is daddy getting angry? Is daddy gonna spank me?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Well that depends ... have you been a baaad gi ..  no I can't.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hello? Hello? Oh, hey Charlie. Did anybody else hear? ... What? Susan got it?? How? Oh man, I would have slept with him!! .. Alright, bye.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Dude, I'm sorry. But hey, there's one spot left, right?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well no, Charlie's gonna get that.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey, don't say that! You got just as good a chance as anybody else of getting that job!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: He's the boss's son.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Come on, lottery!!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ooh, you guys, it starts in like 20 minutes.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Ok, here we go. We need to sort out the tickets as quickly as possible to see if we've won. So does anybody have any ideas how to organize this?  Ok, how about this: we divide them into 6 groups of 40, and the remaining 10 can be read by whoever finishes their pile first.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ooh, I have another idea!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I'm sorry, idea time is over.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Ok, well, are all the tickets in the bowl?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What about the ones you have on the nightstand?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: There are no tickets on the nightstand!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yes there are, I just saw them a few minutes ago.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Un, no you didn't! You must be mistaken!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Honey, there are like 20 tickets on the nightstand!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Chandler, sense the tone!!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well, well, well, look what mommy found!!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Ok, fine!! I bought 20 extra tickets for me and Chandler.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Uh! The psychic also said that I would be betrayed.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I can't believe this, I thought we were all in this together!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey, you just got in 5 minutes ago!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: 3 minutes ago!!! I don't know why that's important ...

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I was with you the whole time we were in Connecticut, when did you even get those?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: When you were reading the dirty magazines without taking off the plastic!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I'll show you how.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ok, well Monica, suppose one of your "special" tickets win? How are you gonna feel when you win the lottery and you lose all your friends?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Please ... if I win the lottery, you guys are not gonna leave me. Someone gave me a basket of mini-muffins last week and I couldn't get rid of you for 3 days!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Chandler, would you just tell her what she did was wrong?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: She's right, you shouldn't have bought tickets just for us ...

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Ahhh!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Let me finish ...  however, it doesn't look like I'm gonna get this job so I can't afford to have principles, so screw you, the tickets are ours!!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: There's the man I married!!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: All right, believe me.If you win the lottery, it's the last you're gonna hear from us!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Fine! Don't be my friends! I'll buy new friends! Yeah, and then I'll pay for their plastic surgery so they'd look just like you!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: OH! Alright, you know what? That's it! I want my share of the tickets !

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah, I want my tickets too ! And I'm buying the Knicks! And Steffi Graff, ah ah!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Than I want mine, too ! And if I win I'm gonna put it all into a very low-yield bond.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, you guys! We've got to keep all the tickets together

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: No, no! We should divide them up  and I should get extra because we used my card to buy them!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey, if anybody gets extra tickets, it should be me! This all thing was my idea!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh, yeah! Thanks for inventing the lottery!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ok, that's it! Just give'em to me! I'll split them up!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: OOOOOHHHHH!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey, hey!!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: OOOOOHHHHH!  Fine, I can't take it anymore! I'm putting an end to this!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, if she jumps, I get her tickets.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: No, no!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: If we are not doing it together, we're not doing it at all! So, say goodbye to your tickets! .

lines.speaker: everyone
lines.text: NO!!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Don't come any closer!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Can I come a little bit closer, valuable things are getting squished...

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: No, what's more important, your friends or money?

lines.speaker: everyone but monica
lines.text: Friends!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Money!  Friends...

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hey Monica, what about your extra tickets?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: They're all in there! Even these five that I hid in my bra ...

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Monica!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Ok, good!  You guys were so scared! There was no way I was gonna dump this... Oh God, no!  I think I broke your bowl.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Go, go, go!!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: What a beautiful night to be running around the street, looking for tickets. And the wind sure made it fun.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Phoebe, we lost half of them.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: So, what? Monica, we have the winning ticket! My psychic said I was gonna win, remember?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Weird.. your psychic didn't mention anything about the scary pigeon...

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: As a matter of fact she said that's how I am going to die.  So, excuse me for being a little skittish.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey, there's two messages. These could be from work!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh, play them!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Ok, here we go!

lines.speaker: message
lines.text: "Hello. Th-this is the pigeon from the balcony calling to apologise"  "I sh.. I shouldn't have knocked the tickets out of the pretty lady's hand. It-it was all my fault. Not hers. Bye. Coo."

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well, I bet that was very hard for him to do.

lines.speaker: second message
lines.text: "Hey Chandler, it's Charlie"

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: This is..shhh!

lines.speaker: second message
lines.text: "Listen, oh... it turns I got the last spot. I'm really sorry man, it was a lot of fun working with you. Give me a call if you want."

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh God, I am so sorry honey...

lines.speaker: all
lines.text: Oh, so sorry man! Sorry!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, it is so unfair. It's like that time they promoted Sandra over me at work.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh, is she related to Ralph Lauren?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No, she was just much better at job than me!

lines.speaker: phoebe

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: You know what? We should call my mum's house and say goodnight to Emma before she goes down.

lines.text: Oh yeah, it's a good idea!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Honey, you've been really strong about this, I know how badly you wanted that job.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah, you know, I really thought I deserved it.  But... let's go win the lottery... I mean, we still have 130 chances to win, right?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Goodnight sweetheart! I love you. And remember, you're daddy's little girl...  Phoebe's totally ruined that for me...

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hi mum, put her back on!

lines.text: Rach, come on! They are announcing the numbers! My God, I can already feel myself changing.

lines.speaker: tv
lines.text: "Here we are, the official Powerball numbers! We have 53"

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I got that!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh, we have one too!!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: We are on a roll, people!!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Come on!!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Mum, please!I know you love your new lips, but I can barely understand you! Would you, please, just let me say goodnight to my daughter?

lines.speaker: tv
lines.text: "And number 29! Here we go! The Powerball is 7"

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Check your numbers! Make me rich!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Guys, you're not gonna believe this! I was just saying goodnight to Emma and she said her first words!!

lines.speaker: all
lines.text: Wow!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: And what did she say?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: She said "gleba"!!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Make me rich!!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Isn't that amazing?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh yeah, no no no...that's great!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Why-why aren't you more excited?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh, Rach...oh..."gleba" is not a word.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, but of course it is!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay, what does it mean?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I don't know all the words.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I'm just, I'm just glad I didn't miss my daughter's first words .

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yes you did, gleba is a word!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Ok, use it in a sentence.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ok... "Emma just said gleba"!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: It's not a word!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay, okay, okay, fine, I'm gonna look it up .

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh, oh, ok, great. You know what, while you're at it she said another word the other day, why don't you, why don't you look up: pbbqqt....

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Alright, okay, okay, gleba, gleba...  Gleba! Ha! Here it is: the fleshy, spore-bearing inner mass of a certain fungi.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: She's gonna be a scientist!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Damnit! anybody got anything?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I'm still looking through mine...

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Just double checking ...no, no, no... No!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hello? Hold on. It's your boss.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Ah, the "I'm sorry I rejected you" phone call. I'm not used to getting it from guys.  Hey, Steve.

lines.speaker: steve
lines.text: Chandler, hi! I'm sure you've heard we filled the three positions. We just felt that with your maturity and experience, you wouldn't be happy being someone's assistant.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh no no no no, I'd love to be somebody's assistant! Answering phones, getting coffee, I live for that stuff! And I'm not too mature... farts, boobies, butt cracks!

lines.speaker: steve
lines.text: Chandler, you were the strongest person in the program. We're offering you the position of junior copywriter.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Me, that guy who just said butt cracks?

lines.speaker: steve
lines.text: Yes, that's right. We're excited about the level of sophistication you'll be bringing to the job.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Ok well, thanks, you won't regret it. I'll see you tomorrow .

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What?  Oh, yeah, I'm gonna be a junior copywriter.

lines.speaker: everybody
lines.text: Oh my God, congratulations!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh sweetie, I'm so proud of you!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Does that mean I get the good loving tonight?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You bet! No TV or anything!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey, that is so great about the job.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Thanks, man.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: And I like to think I had a little something to do with it.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Really? What?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Well, before, with the wishbone... I didn't wish we would win the lottery, I wished you'd get the job.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh yeah?  Listen, don't tell Monica, she'll rip your heart right out.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh yeah.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: You know what? There is a little part of me that really thought we were gonna win.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Me too. So much for my dinosaur/Amelia Earhart theme park.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: You guys, what was the Powerball number again?

lines.speaker: monica and ross
lines.text: Seven.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: We won.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: We won!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Let me see!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Don't tear it.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Phoebe, you don't have any of the first five numbers.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I know that, but look, we've got the Powerball number, we've won 3 dollars!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Wow, you'd think we should get that over 20 years or go for the big payout.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I don't care, I've never won anything before, I can't believe this!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: So Pheebs, what are you going to do with your $3?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: It's not all mine. We all get 50 cents.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You know what? You can have mine.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Me too.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Me too.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Me too.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I guess if everybody else is...

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey guys, so I just called the Powerball hotline, can you believe it? Nobody won.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I beg to differ .

lines.speaker: gunther
lines.text: Maybe nobody won the jackpot, but there was this guy in here earlier, and he found the ticket on the street, right outside, and won $10,000 .

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Coo, again. Don't blame the pretty lady. It was not her fault. It was me, the pigeon, coo!  Seriously, stop staring at her.

lines.text: God, you're beautiful...why are we fighting this?You know you want it to happen as much as I do.

lines.text: I want you.I need you.Let me make love to you.

lines.text: I don't wanna stand in the way of true love or anything, but I think a cantaloupe might hurt less.

lines.text: Oh, ehm...I'm...I'm rehearsing my lines.They gave me a big romantic story on Days Of Our Lives. It's the first time my character's got one. I'm so nervous, you know, I really want it to be good!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Woow!I haven't seen you this worked up since you did that dog food commercial and you thought you were gonna be with a real talking dog!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah, that was a disappointment... Oh, hey!D'you want to come down to the set and tell me if I'm doing ok?

lines.text: Yeah!Hey, you just have to promise not to get yourself thrown out again.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Right!"Oh my God, is this the men's room? Oh, I feel so foolish, have you always known you wanted to be an actor?"

lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hey!

lines.text: Hi!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: So, do you guys wanna come and eat dinner at the restaurant sometime in the next few weeks?

lines.text: Sure!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I'd love to!

lines.speaker: monica

lines.text: Well, I can't give you a massage, because my licence has been revoked again!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Phoebe, what happened?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well, it was an accident...You know, it's a lot of oil and sometimes the hand just slips!

lines.text: Have I got a surprise for you? Pack your bags!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh no!You guys aren't supposed to get divorced for 7 years!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What? No, I'm taking Monica to a romantic inn in Vermont !

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, good!Ok, good for you!Try to recapture the magic!

lines.speaker: chandler

lines.speaker: monica

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Are you really that busy?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yeah, I'm sorry. I really am.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh, that's ok.I'll just try and reschedule.  "Hi, this is Chandler Bing. I made a reservation there and I need to change it  Oh, what do you mean it's not refundable? Can I just come some other time?  Oh, can't you make an exception?"

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Tell them I'm a chef in a big New York restaurant!

lines.speaker: phoebe

lines.text: "Look, this is ridiculous! I'm not paying for that room! Ok?"  "Oh, thank you very much!"  Yeah, I'm going to Vermont...

lines.text: I don't have travel insurance.

lines.text: Why don't you take Ross?

lines.text: Uh, don't you think that would be a little weird? I mean, two guys in a romantic inn...

lines.text: Oh, wish me luck!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ok, not that you need it but good...GOD!Is that Chase Lassiter?He's straight, right?

lines.text: Oh, I so can't believe this! My uterus is an inhospitable environment? I was trying so hard to be a good hostess!

lines.text: Oh, I can't believe my sperm have low motility because, let me tell you, when I was growing up they sure seem to be in a hurry to get places!!

lines.text: Hi there.

lines.text: Hi.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hi.

lines.speaker: doctor connelly
lines.text: I'm sorry there wasn't better news from your test last week but I wanted to talk to you about your options.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Ok.

lines.speaker: doctor connelly
lines.text: Above all, even though your chances of conceiving through natural means aren't great, you never know! So, keep having sex on a regular basis.

lines.text: Oh, DAMN IT!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Don't worry, after a while he'll tune it out.

lines.speaker: doctor connelly
lines.text: Ok, given your situation, the options with the greatest chances for success would be surrogacy, or insemination using a sperm donor.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Ok.

lines.speaker: doctor connelly
lines.text: And, of course, if you feel that neither of those is right for you, you can always adopt.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Is that a hint? Because we love you Doctor Connelly but we don't think we'd want you to be our child!  Wow, talking about an inhospitable environment!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hi! Ok, you're ready to go pick up Phoebe and go shopping?

lines.speaker: charlie
lines.text: Oh, yeah! Let's do it!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Alright, have a good time.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Not gonna find any clothes in there!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey, you guys!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hi.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Guess who's up for keynote speaker at the National Paleontology Conference?

lines.speaker: charlie
lines.text: Umh... Kurts Baley?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah, right! What was last time he met a submission deadline for an abstract  Well, why are you laughing?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Just... seeing what it'd be like to be a paleontologist... it's fun, yeah!

lines.speaker: charlie
lines.text: So you're up for keynote speaker! Who's making the decisions?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Professor Sherman, yeah. I've a meeting with him today.

lines.speaker: charlie
lines.text: He's a pretty tough guy to impress.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah, well... I think I know how to dazzle him.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh... you're not gonna do a magic trick, are ya?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Tsz... NO! .

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey guys!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Wait a minute, you guys. Oh, I wanna ask you something. I-I I may get to speak at this paleontology convention and if I do, I'd love for you guys to come and hear me.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I think I can safely say that we all have family issues, work stuff and/or are sick.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: It's in Barbados.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: But you come first!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I'm there!

lines.speaker: charlie
lines.text: We'll see you, guys!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Bye.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Bye, see ya.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Ok.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: All right, so. How did it go at the fertility clinic?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Not as much fun as last time. Apparently you only get porn if you're giving a sperm sample.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: So-so what did the doctor say?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well... there's surrogacy, but Monica has dreamt her whole life of carrying a child, she has felt that watching a surrogate would be... too hard for her.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: So you're ruling out surrogacy?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: So, I don't have to learn what that means?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Aside from adoption the only other choice is insemination, so... we're talking about sperm donors.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Enough said, I'm there for you man. Where is she, upstairs?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: ah-ha!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: How do you feel about all this?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I wish there was an easier way for us to have a child but I don't think there is one.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Come on Ross, be a good guy. Step up and do it!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What? NO! I am not going to give them Ben!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: The data we are receiving from MRI scans and DNA testing of these fossils are - are staggering.

lines.speaker: professor sherman
lines.text: Mmm-mm.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I mean, we've been accepting Leakey's dates as a given, but if they're off by even a hundred thousand years or so then you can - you can just throw most of our assumptions, you know, right in the trash.  So-so what I am saying is - is is that  is that the repercussions could be huge! I mean, not just in palaeontology, but if-if you think about it, in evolutionary biology, uh, genetics, geology, uh, I mean, truly the mind boggles!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh, that's not what you want...

lines.speaker: shop assistant
lines.text: Incentive For Men?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, I'll take some of that.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Pheebs, that's for men!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: No, I know, this way when I go to the party later Mike will know I am over him cause I'm gonna smell like another guy.  Yeah.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Ok. Oh good, I'm dating a Russian cab driver. . Seriously does anyone buy this? I smell like beets!

lines.speaker: charlie
lines.text: So, you know what, I really like those jackets with the shoulder pads on them. Where do you think those would be?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: On Melanie Griffith in "Working girl". I think what you want is over here.

lines.speaker: charlie
lines.text: See, I told you I needed someone! Oh, you know, by the way, as a "thank you", I would really love to take you out.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: charlie
lines.text: Yeah! Actually Joey and I are going to the movies tonight, wanna come?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, I can't. Because I-I've seen them.

lines.speaker: charlie
lines.text: You've seen all the movies...

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah! I'm a big fan! Of the movies, you know. Motion pictures. The Talkies!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hey Rach, will you come with me to a dressing room?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Sure!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Ok!

lines.speaker: charlie
lines.text: Wha, you know, maybe we can do something else!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: You know that depends on what it is! I've done a lot of stuff.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: So what were you doing out there, do you not like Charlie?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: She's ok, I just don't get a really good vibe from her!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Why?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I don't know, you know, just the way she waltzed in here all smart, and tall! You know, and just swept Joey off his feet... I mean, nobody else has a chance!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Who else?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Anybody! You, me, you know, Monica's mom...

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: You like Joey?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Shhhhh! Phoebe! All right, look. I have a little thing for him.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh my God!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: It's just physical and I have it totally under control! Ok? It's just, when I see them together, sometimes I just get a little jealous!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Uh, wow! Isn't it ironic that he liked you and now you like him?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, I get it!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh well, as long as it is under control, you know, you can't do anything about it, he's already dating her, and she is a nice person, that wouldn't be right.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I know, I know, so it is just not a big deal.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: So can we keep this between us?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Sure!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ok, great, because I gotta get out of here, the smell of beets is killing me!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Any chance Charlie has a deaf twin?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hi honey!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey! Look I brought a friend for dinner, this is Zack, from work!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh, of course, it's so nice to see you again, Zack!

lines.speaker: zack
lines.text: You too.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You guys haven't actually met before, but, boy! You're both polite!  Go to have a seat Zack, and I'll get you a beer.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I got it.

lines.speaker: zack
lines.text: Thanks.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: So, Zack's pretty nice, uh?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yeah, I guess.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: So, how would you like to have a baby that's half yours and half his!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Excuse me?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, we're talking about sperm donors and Zack may be the guy! I mean, look, he's intelligent, he's healthy, he's athletic, I mean, he is "spermtastic"!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Chandler, this is crazy! What did you even say to him! "Come up, meet my wife! Give us your sperm"!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: No, I invited him to dinner so you could get a chance to get to know him! I mean, if we go through a sperm bank you never meet the guy, get to check him out.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Chandler!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I'm telling you, he's great! I mean, even if my sperm worked fine, I'd think he'd be the way to go!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I'm not going to be a part of this! You can't just bring some random guy at home and expect him to be our sperm donor!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Ok!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Uh!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Zack!

lines.speaker: zack
lines.text: Thanks! Do you have a coaster? I don't wanna make a ring.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Tell me about yourself, Zack!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, God, do you think she heard? It would be so bad if she heard!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well, maybe she didn't hear! Ok I'm gonna go into that dressing room, you stay in here and I'll talk and see if you can hear me.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ok, great!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, thank God I can't hear a word that you're saying!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I didn't say anything yet!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well, get back in there and talk!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I'm Rachel. It's so annoying when I put Emma on the phone to talk with my friends.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What!?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well, some things are just hard to say to your face.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ok well, I heard that! Which means that she heard it too!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Ooh! We have a problem.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh! What are we gonna do?

lines.speaker: stranger
lines.text: Just be honest with her.

lines.text: Oh my God!
